official-title.#text:
To provide employees with 2 hours of paid leave in order
		  to vote in Federal elections.

committee-name.#text:
Committee
			 on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Requirement for 2
			 hours paid leave to vote in Federal elections

text.#text:
An employee shall be
			 entitled to 2 hours of paid leave on the day of any Federal election in order
			 to vote.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the employer of such employee may designate the 2-hour period
			 during which the employee may take leave. Any lunch break or other break period
			 may not be included in the 2-hour period designated for leave.

text.#text: For each employee taking leave under

The taking of leave
			 under this section shall not result in the loss of any employment benefit
			 accrued prior to the date on which the leave was taken.

It
			 shall be unlawful for any employer to interfere with, restrain, or deny the
			 exercise of or the attempt to exercise, the right to take leave under this Act,
			 or to discriminate against an employee in any manner for taking leave under
			 this Act.

header.#text:
Interference
			 with rights under this Act

text.#text:
It shall be unlawful for any employer to
			 discharge or in any other manner discriminate against any individual
			 for—

opposing any
			 practice made unlawful by this section;

giving or
			 preparing to give any information in connection with any inquiry or proceeding
			 relating to any leave provided under this section; or

testifying or
			 preparing to testify in any inquiry or proceeding relating to any leave
			 provided under this section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall have investigative authority with respect to the provisions of this
			 subsection in the same manner and under the same terms and conditions as the
			 investigative authority provided under

of such
			 Act shall apply to employers under this subsection in the same manner as such
			 requirements apply to employers under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993/s:106
Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993/s:106

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 106 of the Family and Medical
			 Leave Act of 1993
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993/s:106

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for deposit into the Treasury of
			 the United States and shall accrue to the United States and may be recovered in
			 a civil action in the name of the United States brought in the United States
			 district court for the district where the violation is alleged to have occurred
			 or where the employer has its principal office.

text.#text:
Any employer that violates this Act may be subject to a
			 civil penalty not to exceed $10,000 per violation. Civil penalties shall be
			 assessed by and paid to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall give due consideration to the appropriateness of the
			 penalty with respect to the size of the business of the employer being charged,
			 the gravity of the violation, the good faith of the employer, and the history
			 of previous violations.

text.#text:
In assessing a civil penalty under this
			 Act, the

term.#tail:
has the
			 meaning given such term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3 of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938

section
			 101(1) of the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993/s:101/p:1

term.#tail:
means any
			 person engaged in commerce or in any industry or activity affecting commerce
			 who employs 25 or more employees during a calendar year, and includes any
			 person who acts, directly or indirectly, in the interest of an employer to any
			 of the employees of such employer and any successor in interest of an employer.
			 In the previous sentence, the terms
have the meaning given such terms in

text.#text:
This section shall take effect beginning with the first
			 Federal election held after the date of enactment of this Act.
